explanation: The original if-line only checks for one specific ordering (S1 == ".#" and S2 == "#."). The intended logic is to print "No" when the two strings are opposite patterns, regardless of their order. I fixed the single line by adding the symmetric check with OR so both (S1 == ".#" and S2 == "#.") and (S1 == "#." and S2 == ".#") are handled.
